History¶

The History class is used to record and access historical time-series data.

class History¶

Represents your time-series history.

This is the core ShardDNA class - it allows you to create historical storage and read and write time-series data.

Public Functions

bool Init(HistoryConfig Cfg)¶

Initialises a History object.

Return

Returns true if successful, otherwise false

Parameters

  • Cfg: Configuration details for this historian

DStore GetShard(TIMESTAMP tm, bool create)¶

Gets a shard that covers the specified time frame.

Return

A smart-pointer to data store, or ‘null’ if the call fails.

Parameters

  • tm: The time-frame for the shard

  • create: If true, the shard is created if it doesn’t already exist.

DStore GetNextShard(TIMESTAMP tm)¶

Gets the NEXT shard based on a time frame.

Return

A smart-pointer to data store, or ‘null’ if the call fails.

Parameters

  • tm: The time-frame for the shard

PCursor GetNextShardWith(TIMESTAMP tm, const char *series)¶

Gets the NEXT shard based on a time frame and a series name.

Return

A smart-pointer to data store, or ‘null’ if the call fails.

Parameters

  • tm: The time-frame for the shard

  • series: The name/code of the time-series

bool SeriesExists(const char *name)¶

Checks if a particular time series exists.

Return

Returns true if the series exists, otherwise false

Parameters

  • name: The name/code for the time-series

SeriesInfo GetSeries(const char *name, SeriesInfo *SI)¶

Gets or sets the SeriesInfo for a named series.

Return

Parameters

  • name: The name/code of the time-series

  • SI: The SeriesInfo to write if the series doesn’t exist, or NULL if it should not create the series.

bool RecordValue(const char *name, double Value)¶

Record a value at the current time, with no options.

Return

Returns true if successful, otherwise false.

Parameters

  • name: The name/code of the time-series

  • Value: The value to write

bool RecordValue(const char *name, double Value, TIMESTAMP Stamp, int Options = 0)¶

Records a value to the Time-Series.

Return

Returns true if successful, otherwise false

Parameters

  • name: The name/code for the time-series

  • Value: The value to record

  • Stamp: The time-stamp to write to

  • Options: Any options regarding this write (currently unused)

TSPoint GetLatest(const char *name)¶

Returns the latest value for a given series Note that this function heavily accesses the hard-drive and is NOT intended for polling or other routine checking for live data.

Return

Returns true if successful, otherwise false

Parameters

  • name: The name/code for the time-series

ShardCursor *GetHistory(const char *name, TIMESTAMP from, TIMESTAMP to)¶

Get history for a single channel.

Return

returns a ShardCursor to navigate the results

Parameters

  • name: The name/code for the time-series

  • from: The date to begin the query

  • to: The date to end the query (otherwise 0)

QueryCursor *GetHistory(Query Q)¶

Get the raw history for one or more channels.

Return

returns a QueryCursor to navigate the results

Parameters

  • Q: The Query object containing query details

QueryCursor *GetHistory(AggregatedQuery Q)¶

Get the aggregated/interpolated history for one or more channels.

Return

returns a QueryCursor to navigate the results

Warning

Not yet implemented

Parameters

  • Q: The AggregatedQuery object containing query details

void ShardDiagnostics()¶

Internal function to display all shards on standard output
